channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Apple reaches deal with EU regulators to open up mobile payments system to rivals
item.description: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager said the European Commission accepted commitments from Apple to open access to its tap and go payments tech to rivals.

item.title: NATO condemns China as a 'decisive enabler' of Russia's war in Ukraine in most serious rebuke to date
item.description: NATO labeled Beijing a "decisive enabler" of Russia's war in Ukraine and expressed concern over Beijing's "systemic challenges" to the coalition's security.

item.title: UK economy returns to growth in May, beating expectations as British pound hits four-month high
item.description: UK gross domestic product figures for May were published Thursday.

item.title: China's robotaxi push sparks concerns about job security for drivers
item.description: China's yearslong effort to develop robotaxis is starting to gain traction with consumers — and rattling taxi drivers who are worried about losing their jobs

item.title: Key inflation report looms on Thursday as traders grow more confident in Fed rate cut
item.description: The June consumer price index will be released Thursday, with traders eyeing September for the Federal Reserve's first rate cut.

item.title: Treasury, IRS announce 'major milestone' of $1 billion in past-due taxes collected from millionaires
item.description: The U.S. Department of the Treasury and IRS announced a "major milestone" of collecting more than $1 billion in past-due taxes from millionaires.

item.title: JPMorgan is bullish on this Southeast Asian country, cites opportunities in data centers
item.description: The investment bank upgraded Malaysia to "neutral" from "underweight" last week, raising its target for the Kuala Lumpur Composite Index.

item.title: An investment banker quit her job to become a YouTuber and now makes over $1 million
item.description: An investment banker who quit her job to become a YouTuber — just two months before a six-figure bonus — now has over 1 million subscribers.

item.title: Samsung launches latest foldable phones in the face of rising competition and Apple's AI play
item.description: Samsung took the wraps off the Galaxy Z Fold6 and Z Flip6, which come with improvements from previous models and AI features from translation to photo editing.

item.title: Japan is worried about another 'transactional' Trump presidency, Tokyo-based expert says
item.description: The Japanese government was "pretty certain that Biden had this well in hand." However, the ruling LDP is now reappraising the odds of a "Trump 2.0 presidency."

item.title: Samsung to launch upgraded voice assistant Bixby this year with its own AI
item.description: Samsung will launch an upgraded version of its voice assistant Bixby this year based on its own artificial intelligence models, mobile chief TM Roh told CNBC.

item.title: Bill Gross says Tesla is the new meme stock
item.description: Longtime investor Bill Gross believes Elon Musk's Tesla is behaving like a speculative play among retail investors.

item.title: UK launches new rules for listings in bid to boost growth for London's stock exchange
item.description: The U.K.’s Financial Conduct Authority has announced new rules for stock market listings in the country which aim to “boost growth and innovation.”

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: A true bull market — it's not Wall Street
item.description: S&P 500 closes above 5,600 for the first time. Archegos founder convicted of market manipulation. Tesla is a "meme stock."

item.title: Shares of Stellar Blade maker Shift Up surge almost 50% on trading debut
item.description: The company sold 7.25 million shares in its IPO, raising 435 billion won or about $315.56 million.

item.title: Japanese warship entered China's waters near Taiwan despite warnings, domestic media reports
item.description: A Japanese navy destroyer entered Chinese territorial waters recently in spite of repeated warnings, local news reported.

item.title: Man caught attempting to smuggle 104 live snakes in his pants at China border
item.description: A man attempting to smuggle 104 live snakes in his pants was caught at a Chinese border this week, according to the country's customs authority.

item.title: Japan's Nikkei smashes past 42,000 mark to all-time highs as Asia markets rally on rate cut optimism
item.description: In Asia, investors will be watching for any spillover optimism in the region's tech stocks, particularly in Japan.

item.title: Samsung launches the Galaxy Ring — a first-of-its-kind product for the tech giant
item.description: The Samsung Galaxy Ring has the ability to track various health metrics such as heart rate and sleep.

item.title: Musk says next Neuralink brain implant expected soon, despite issues with the first patient
item.description: Neuralink is gearing up to implant its second human patient, despite hardware challenges with the first patient.

item.title: As NATO meets, leaders look to 'Trump-proof' the military alliance
item.description: As NATO meets in Washington, the alliance is facing familiar foes and challenges. The prospect of another Donald Trump presidency is one of them.

item.title: HubSpot shares plunge 12% on report that Alphabet is shelving interest in acquiring software company
item.description: Alphabet has reportedly shelved its interest in acquiring HubSpot months after the companies were in talks.

item.title: China is leading on GenAI experimentation, but lags U.S. in implementation, survey shows
item.description: Chinese companies lead the world in general generative AI use but are still behind the U.S. in full implementation, a new survey finds.

item.title: 'Don't get tired': Samsung Electronics workers extend strike indefinitely, say chip production disrupted
item.description: This is the first strike by the labor union in Samsung Electronics' entire 55-year history, according to local media.

item.title: NASA still expects Boeing's Starliner to return astronauts from ISS, but notes SpaceX backup option
item.description: Officials say Starliner capsule "Calypso" may return as soon as the end of this month from its extended ISS stay.

item.title: Barcelona protesters throw items and spray travelers with water while shouting ‘tourists go home’
item.description: The protesters — angry about the city's long-standing problems with overtourism — also used tape to block hotel entrances and sidewalk cafes in Barceloneta.

item.title: Number of millionaires to soar globally but plunge in the UK, research finds
item.description: The 2024 Global Wealth Report from UBS forecasts a continued increase in the number of millionaires, with the U.K. a notable outlier.

item.title: Volkswagen shares slip as it considers Brussels plant closure on weak EV demand
item.description: Volkswagen shares dipped after the company issued an overnight profit warning and announced it was considering the potential closure of an Audi plant.

item.title: Microsoft drops its observer seat on OpenAI board amid regulatory scrutiny
item.description: Microsoft took a nonvoting board seat at OpenAI back in November.

item.title: Here's everything announced at Samsung's big launch event, from the Galaxy Ring to foldables
item.description: On Wednesday, Samsung held its Unpacked Event, where it launched a slew of products, including the Galaxy Ring, redesigned Buds3, and two foldable phones.
